stories.headline: Separate & Unequal
stories.summary: Analysis reveals that high-income families are opting out of Cincinnati public schools, with only 78% choosing public education compared to higher rates in other cities, posing a risk of socio-economic segregation.

stories.headline: Record Fight
stories.summary: An investigation into Detroit Public Schools uncovering principals earning extra cash for duties others do for free, amidst salary negotiations.

stories.headline: Inexperience Reigns
stories.summary: The Baltimore Sun highlights the issue of inexperienced teachers being concentrated in disadvantaged schools, affecting student achievement.

stories.headline: Minority Teachers Missing
stories.summary: Data analysis reveals a significant lack of minority teachers compared to student demographics in Oklahoma, shifting focus from black to other minority groups.
